answers.answer: Hi, the symptoms you experienced could be due to a prodromal phase of an infection, before the actual signs are evident. They could also be due some metabolic disorders like diabetes mellitus or thyroid disorders. They could even be premenstrual symptoms. Sometimes anxiety or stress can cause similar effects. Only a consultation with your primary care physician can help diagnose. Regards.

question: 4 weeks ago I woke up in the night with severe stomach cramps, heart palpitations, a fever and the feeling to be sick. I stayed awake for the rest of the night, eventually falling to sleep at about 6am! I then some with out feeling ill. 2 weeks later this happened again and then happened again last night! Once or twice I can understand but as it had happened again I have booked in to see the doctor tomorrow morning! Has anyone else had this?
title: Nausea during the night
